title: Covid: US reports record 1m cases with peak still to come
description: Omicron drives a record-breaking daily tally of new US cases, though deaths remain stable.

title: Kazakhstan unrest: State of emergency declared after fuel protests
description: President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev declares a two-week state of emergency including curbs on movement.

title: 'No special favour or special opportunity granted to Djokovic', says Australian Open chief Tiley
description: Novak Djokovic will defend his Australian Open title after receiving a medical exemption from having a Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Kane 'totally involved' in Spurs project - Conte
description: Tottenham manager Antonio Conte says Harry Kane is "totally involved" in his project at Spurs after it appeared the striker would leave last summer.

title: Covid: Critical incidents declared over staff shortages
description: Norfolk's health care system is placed on the highest alert as other health trusts raise the alarm.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson plans to 'ride out' Omicron wave with no more curbs
description: Boris Johnson backs keeping England's Plan B, but says parts of NHS will feel "temporarily overwhelmed".

title: Newcastle agree £12m fee for Atletico and England full-back Trippier
description: Newcastle United agree to sign England full-back Kieran Trippier from Atletico Madrid for a £12m fee plus add-ons.

title: Pregnancy: 'I felt fat-shamed by banter at my 12-week scan'
description: A study finds women with obesity can feel "deeply stigmatised" during pregnancy.

title: Prince Andrew: Decision soon on dismissing case - judge
description: A US court hears arguments about a deal the prince's accuser Virginia Giuffre agreed with Jeffrey Epstein.

title: 'I am sorry for the upset I have caused' - apologetic Lukaku returns to Chelsea squad for cup semi-final
description: Romelu Lukaku apologises for interview comments and will return to the Chelsea squad for Wednesday's Carabao Cup semi-final against Tottenham.

title: Prince Andrew: Emily Maitlis on the 'jaw-dropping' TV interview 'critical' to sexual assault case
description: Emily Maitlis says Prince Andrew's interview with her is now "critical" to the sexual assault case.

title: Costa Book Awards: Robert Maxwell biography among winners
description: John Preston charts the rise and fall of the notorious media mogul who was found dead at sea in 1991.

title: Banksy: Port Talbot man wanted to destroy Season's Greetings
description: Witnesses heard the 42-year-old say he wanted to "kill" the painting to stop it leaving Port Talbot.

title: Liverpool request Carabao Cup match at Arsenal is postponed because of rise in Covid cases
description: Liverpool make a formal request to postpone Thursday's Carabao Cup semi-final first leg at Arsenal because of an increase in Covid-19 cases.

title: Covid: Daily tests for key workers and lockdown food bartering in China
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday evening.

title: Taking pictures of breastfeeding mothers in public to be made illegal in England and Wales
description: Justice Secretary Dominic Raab says the law will stop women being pestered in public.

title: 'Everything on the table' in Ashes review - Giles
description: "Everything will be on the table" when England review their Ashes defeat in Australia, says managing director Ashley Giles.

title: The 21-year-old from Scotland set to become an NFL star
description: David Ojabo didn't play American football growing up in Aberdeenshire. Now he is set to be picked in the first round of the NFL draft.

title: Tony Blair: Petition to block knighthood tops 600,000 signatures
description: The ex-PM is accused of war crimes, but Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer says his honour is deserved.

title: Second man charged over Amber Gibson's death
description: Amber Gibson's brother has already been charged with her murder after her body was found in November.

title: California twins born 15 minutes apart in two different years
description: Aylin Trujillo arrived exactly at midnight on 1 January 2022, 15 minutes after her brother Alfredo.

title: Sir Keir Starmer sets out vision of 'straight leadership'
description: The Labour leader seeks to build on his party's poll lead by promising to restore trust if he wins power.

title: Murray loses in Melbourne, GB beaten by Canada in ATP Cup
description: A frustrated Andy Murray loses to world number 76 Facundo Bagnis in Melbourne in his first match of 2022

title: We can't jab world every four to six months - scientist
description: The most vulnerable should be prioritised for further doses instead, says Prof Sir Andrew Pollard.

title: France's Bogdanoff TV twins die of Covid six days apart
description: Grichka and Igor Bogdanoff had hosted a TV science and science-fiction show in the 1980s.

title: Channel migrants: Crossing numbers in 2021 triple 2020's figure
description: The Home Office is “reforming” its approach to asylum, following 28,400 people crossing the Channel.

title: Covid: More hospital trusts declare 'critical incident' over staff shortages
description: At least seven trusts have taken steps to protect services in the past week, amid staff shortages.

title: Silicon Valley's trial of the century
description: A look at the Theranos trial and the evidence that led to Elizabeth Holmes being found guilty of fraud.

title: Nirvana's Nevermind cover art lawsuit dismissed
description: Spencer Elden, who was pictured as a baby on the album cover, had alleged child pornography.

title: NFL: Ben Roethlisberger bids farewell to Pittsburgh Steelers fans in style
description: Watch the best moments from Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger's likely final home game at Heinz Field, as they beat the Cleveland Browns 26-14.

title: Adele's 30 was the biggest-selling album of 2021
description: The star's fourth album sold more than 500,000 copies, while Ed Sheeran had the top-selling single.

title: Elizabeth Holmes: Theranos founder convicted of fraud
description: The Silicon Valley ex-CEO faces up to 80 years in prison for her failed blood testing technology.

title: 'I was a heroin addict - but ended up guarding Buckingham Palace'
description: How a heroin addict got himself off drugs to become a Scots Guard.

title: 'Caged tiger' Broad recalled by England for fourth Ashes Test
description: Bowler Stuart Broad is recalled by England for the fourth Ashes Test against Australia in Sydney, replacing Ollie Robinson.

title: The Papers: NHS staffing 'crisis' and 'secret' Epstein deal
description: The front pages focus on Covid's impact on the NHS and a 2009 deal between Epstein and Virginia Giuffre.

title: Pardons extended to all abolished same-sex crimes
description: More people, living or dead, will be eligible to have historical convictions wiped from their records.

title: Pushpa: Why a song calling out men is under fire for sleaze
description: A new hit song which claims to subvert the male gaze is accused of, in fact, objectifying women.

title: How my pregnancy led to a life-changing diagnosis
description: Helena Merriman was diagnosed with otosclerosis, which causes hearing loss, after her second child was born.

title: Why BlackBerry held the tiny keys to my heart
description: The classic smartphone's life comes to an end on 4 January as the firm switches off support.

title: The rise and fall of Elizabeth Holmes
description: The founder of the once promising start-up Theranos has been found guilty of fraud. What went wrong?

title: Is there a better way to make new resolutions stick?
description: There are lots of apps that promise to make you healthier and happier but are they any good?

title: Africa's lost 'Motown' years rediscovered
description: African music from the 1980s is being digitised thanks to a young Parisian producer.

title: Watching North Korea from a supersonic fighter jet
description: BBC correspondent Laura Bicker reports from a supersonic fighter jet on South Korea’s drive to build up its own war machine.

title: Sound Of 2022: Mimi Webb makes music to break up to... as her ex-boyfriend found out
description: Inspired by Adele, the singer's emotionally-charged music even led to the end of her own relationship.
